title: Proability of Events with Equally Likely Outcomes
text: The probability of an event E in an experiment with sample space S with equally likely outcomes is given by: P(E) $$=$$ (# of elements in E)/(# of elements in S)
speech: The probability of an event E in an experiment with sample space S with equally likely outcomes is given by: P(E)  is equal to  (# of elements in E)/(# of elements in S)
pacedSpeech: The probability of an event E in an experiment with sample space S with equally likely outcomes is given by: P(E)   is equal to
(# of elements in E)/(# of elements in S)

title: Number of Event Elements
text: How many elements result in four heads or four tails?
speech: How many elements result in four heads or four tails?
pacedSpeech: How many elements result in four heads or four tails?

title: Number of Sample Space Elements
text: How many elements are there in the sample space?
speech: How many elements are there in the sample space?
pacedSpeech: How many elements are there in the sample space?

title: Finding the Probability
text: What is the probaility of tossing four heads or four tails?
speech: What is the probaility of tossing four heads or four tails?
pacedSpeech: What is the probaility of tossing four heads or four tails?
